Really fun, simple, addictive game. Gotta love the horror element to it.

However there are some big problems that prevents it from being perfect:
- Terrible hit box
- Connection problems
- Long wait/downloads
- Devs pushing DLC

Get it on sale if you can !

After playing the game for many hours on PC and console, I can say that the game is fun to play and I recommend that you buy it. If you play it with friends it makes it even better. The game isn't perfect and there are bug that will piss you off at time but if you excuse those bugs and carry one playing you'll understand that the game isn't that bad. The game also get new updates with a bit of new content and for some festive holidays there will be special events.

If you haven't played the game yet I recommend that you buy it. If you also convince your friends to get it as well both you and your friends will have fun. If you're not sure you would like the game you can also wait to get it when it goes on sale since its really cheap when it does. You also may want to get of the DLC'S so you can have perks that will help you.


EDIT: 2022/07/31

This game has gone to shit, there has been so much more tunnelling and camping after patch 6.1.0 and the increase of hackers just made this game boring. There hasn't been a single match where a person hasn't disconnected and every game now takes extremely long to finish that it makes it boring. The time that you waste on this game is not worth it, the devs have taken out all the fun for both killers and survivors all you do when you load in to a match is see someone disconnect, the killer camp and tunnel you, or some hacker.

BHVR needs to do something because this has been one of the worst patches they released it has made both sides boring to play the fun that this game used to bring to me is no longer there. Some of the perks changes are understandable, but others make you question wtf BHVR was smoking when the thought of the idea. Overall this game is no longer what it used to be, its too toxic now and everyone hates each other.

It has issues obviously but it's worth playing even if it isn't really scary. The community can suck and the glitches can be annoying as hell but it's an overall really fun game especially if you have people to play with or at least a mic. I have to add this though. fix the fact that every damn update I have to uninstall and reinstall this game, I don't really have THAT bad of download time but it is really annoying that every time there's a small bug fix i have to wait an hour for a 2 second update because i had to completely uninstall then reinstall the game.

This game is not worth $20 in the state that it is in. It is very unbalanced towards killers and makes it incredibly difficult for survivors. Any half competent killer can destroy good survivors. It is fun for the first 5 hours(ish) but when you go up against people that know what they are doing at all it makes it unremarkably unbalanced. Get this when it is 5 bucks. That isn't even touching on how many microtransactions this thing is full of. $10 per DLC is a little greedy to me but that's just my opinion.

Tan solo 6 horas y debo decir que amo este juego. Lo amo, lo amo y lo amo.

Si eres fan de las películas clásicas de asesinos, pues este juego sin lugar a dudas es para ti. Tendrás la oportunidad de encarnar a tu asesino favorito (si es que está en el rooster de selección) y podrás atormentar, torturar y matar brutalmente a tus víctimas, si es que estas te dan la oportunidad. Esto y si te gusta ser asesino (como es mi caso), pero si por el contrario te gusta ser perseguido, podrás encarnar a la víctima del respectivo asesino, y ser perseguido por este. Tendrás que hallar la manera de escapar y salir ileso.

Hablando de apartados técnicos, pues la verdad he de decir que me encanta en la mayoría de aspectos. Jugar como sobreviviente es divertido, y jugar como asesino todavía más. He encontrado algunos fallos o detalles faltantes como: Que quiero jugar como asesino, y el sistema de matchmaking suele ser tardado, pero en cambio busco ser sobreviviente e inmediatamente me encuentra partida. Otra cosa es que me hubiese gustado que se agregaran más objetivos que solo reparar generadores para abrir la puerta y escapar. En mi DLC favorito (el de SAW), las trampas para osos que le pongo a mis víctimas, la animación es excelente cuando el contador llega a 0, pero el detalle la cara destrozada in game me dejó un mal sabor de boca, aún teniendo en cuenta que el trailer muestra otra cosa.

¿Debería comprarlo? ¿Vale la pena? Un rotundo sí te voy a decir.

então só tenho uma coisa a dizer sobre este jogo,é magnifico nunca perdi tanto tempo em um jogo como esse,enfim pretendo morrer jogando esse jogo e bem na hora q eu morrer no jogo eu morro de verdade,enfim em uma bela madrugada meu pai me pegou jogando dbd né e ele se interessou tanto q jogou um pouco tbm até minha mãe expulsar nos dois de casa e ficar com o pc,até q um dia a gente achou um note no lixo,e começamos a jogar e foi tão bom parecia q vc n dormia fazia anos e dps que vc começou a jogar slw vc estava descansado, e roubados a net de alguem pq sim,e jogamos,enfim moral da historia é, jogue esse jogo até sua miseravel vida acabar okk recomendo dms,perca sempre suas noites de sono jogando isso,e tbm quase morra muitas vezes de susto,e pra finalizar jogue 3 dias seguidos isso não faz mal a ngm né

If you like ring around the rosy, this is the game for you.  It seems to be balanced in favor of survivors, at least for most of the free killers, except maybe the nurse.  40% of the survivors are cheaters.  30% of people will "hit" me with a pallet that I stopped well short of knowing that they were going to throw it down.  10% will be able to blind me with a flashlight even after I turned away from them.  Even though you are supposed to be able to interrupt and grab people while they are pulling someone off a hook, it basically never works.  People crawl under hooked people so it is impossible to grab them.  In my last game, I watched someone walk into a locker 5 feet in front of me, and when I opened it, they weren't there and had teleported away. Most everyone BMs and stands around the exit and crouches repeatedly instead of running out, wasting my time and making me go up and hit them all to force them to run out, instead of moving on to the next game.  Then they have to gall to whine in chat afterwards about actually using abilities in the game (god forbid) like No Escape From Death, which is basically required to stop them from just casually walking right past you to the exit, taking the hit, and just running right on out with no way to stop them.

They annoyingly don't show people's names in game, so if you do see a cheater, you have to waste time chasing them trying to hit them so you can find out who it is, or just report the whole team and let the devs figure it out, if they even do anything.

This is a good concept, and would be a good game if not for the players, or if the devs would fix the exploits and balance it.

I played this game on console before I made the switch to PC, the PC support does seem quite a bit better, but if you have buddies on console there's crossplay now, so you can still play with them without them having to buy the game all over again.

This is probably the best iteration I've seen of the asymetric multi-player game. There are some "rules" that would be hard to learn unless someone teaches you them, mostly behavioural stuff to keep the game fun. Without going into the nitty gritty of it, the best way I can summarize it is this: you're not trying to win, you're trying to accomplish as much as possible in a match as you can. Because even if you don't "win", if you do a ton of stuff (survivors: healing, unhooking, working on as many generators as possible. Killers: Chasing as many survivors as possible, using your special, hooking even if it means they don't get sacrificed) you will get extra experience points and will be able to progress your characters. 

All around it's an extremely fun game, if you don't want to spend any money on extra characters you don't have to, but there are some really fun DLC characters like Pyramid Head and the Demogorgon.

Almost 300 hundred hours in. Mostly as survivor. A lot of that time is spent not playing the game thanks to long load times and poor optimization. This game is 5 years old and the only way you could tell that is by looking at it. It remains full of balance issues and bugs. New content must often be disabled for weeks after purchase as they try to fix the thing they wanted money for. There is fun to be had in the game but you either need to play with friends or have a high tolerance for nonsense. Plenty of toxic behavior that there isn't any true counter for. I kept coming back to it hoping it would get better as time progressed but they can't help but drop the ball again and again. Survivors still just do banal qt events every game. They've added to the lore but not to the mechanics. Killer can be more engaging for certain but seems to bring out the worst in people. The bloodweb (your method of progression) is uninspired and gets worse the more characters you level. Suffice it to say, I like the premise but loathe the execution and how much the developer seems to not care. You should find a game that will better reward you for your efforts.
